newsitem.title: USA: Mobil awards North Sumatra natgas contract.
newsitem.headline: Mobil awards North Sumatra natgas contract.

text.p: Mobil Corp said P.T. Tripatra Engineers and Constructors has been awarded a lump sum turnkey contract for a pipeline to develop the North Sumatra Offshore "A" natural gas field.

Under the terms of the proposed contract for over $300 million, Tripatra will be the lead contractor for a consortium that includes Toyo Engineering Corp and McDermott International Inc, Mobil said. It said the overall project cost will exceed $500 million.

The letter of intent authorizes Tripatra to commence work immediately in accordance with terms of the proposed contract. The award of this contract was approved by Indonesian authorities on February 26, Mobil said.

Mobil operates the North Sumatra Offshore block, located in the Malacca Strait off the northeast coast of Sumatra, and holds a 100 percent working interest in the production sharing contract with Pertamina, Indonesia's state oil and gas company. The field, located in 354 feet of water and located about 60 miles from the P.T. Arun LNG plant, will produce 450 million standard cubic feet per day of natural gas LNG plant feed beginning in July 1999.
